availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew H. Clark (Owsley County, Kentucky, farmer and colonel (U.S.A.))

body.p: Owsley County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Clark. Farmer in Owsley County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 47th Kentucky Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as lieutenant colonel and colonel from October 20, 1863 to December 26, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 459-460.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley, p.307.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley, Booneville, p. 322A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 440.
